channel.title: Wierd Body/Mind Experience
channel.description:
Every now and again, I have this weird experience.
I don't really know how to explain it, but its seems somewhat like my body is all hyper, doing shit fast, whereas my mind is calm and relaxed. I have occasionally had this feeling throughout my life, with my most recent time being today while playing TF2. My hands were moving, shooting, killing, quick reactions and shit, possibly better than how I play normally, and my mind was calm and at points off in semi-day dreams. I wasn't concentrating on TF2 at all, yet I was still playing quite well, its as if I was on auto-pilot.
Each time I get this, its the same kind of thing, my body seems to be doing everything by itself in fast motion, whereas my mind is off thinking about different shit, usually thinking about how weird the current experience is.
Has anyone else ever had this experience?

item.title: Wierd Body/Mind Experience
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Sorry, but you don’t have superpowers.

Read full topic

item.title: Wierd Body/Mind Experience
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Would just like to note that this doen’t just happen while gaming. A few weeks ago I got the same thing, but I wasn’t doing anything, I remember I was actually getting dressed at the time. So, for me at least, its not limited to doing some activity that requires concentration.

Read full topic

item.title: Wierd Body/Mind Experience
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

I used to feel this way wile playing Halo 3 when it 1st came out, headshot here, quad-shot there - just over all beastmode.

Read full topic

item.title: Wierd Body/Mind Experience
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

maniown:

I get in this sort of trance when i’m doing something physically active, such as motocross. But it happens when I play video games also.

Ahhh… so that’s how you almost decapitated yourself on that barbed-wire fence.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:

[quote=“Teh Spede, post:12, topic:336808”]Have to go with Tico with this. My eyes get out of focus, but I actually do pretty good in MW2 when this happens.[/quote]just putting it out there, but it helps if you dont try to aim in mw2

item.title: Wierd Body/Mind Experience
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

A lot of the time this happens when you are doing something you are passionate about, I’m sure any guitar player on MITB will know this. Also, sometimes happens in sex too.

item.title: Wierd Body/Mind Experience
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

srt8:

I have experienced this as well, but the opposite. When it happens to me, I’m usually just doing normal things like cooking, watching TV, or studying. My mind starts to race and I can’t stop it, then I will raise my hand and it looks like it is going in slow motion.

Women…

Read full topic

item.title: Wierd Body/Mind Experience
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Budda, post:1, topic:336808”]Every now and again, I have this weird experience.

I don’t really know how to explain it, but its seems somewhat like my body is all hyper, doing shit fast, whereas my mind is calm and relaxed.
I have occasionally had this feeling throughout my life, with my most recent time being today while playing TF2. My hands were moving, shooting, killing, quick reactions and shit, possibly better than how I play normally, and my mind was calm and at points off in semi-day dreams.
I wasn’t concentrating on TF2 at all, yet I was still playing quite well, its as if I was on auto-pilot.[/quote]

This often happens to me when I am burnt out hours after smoking weed. I am almost day dreaming, playing FPS games or games like guitar hero/rockband on auto pilot. And doing amazing too.

Read full topic

item.title: Wierd Body/Mind Experience
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Same, mw2, it seems to happen more often at night when I’m started to get tired, or when I’m listening to music. Same things happen, I feel like I’m twitching when I press move the controller and press buttons, but I’m actually playing.

Read full topic

item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

Yep, this happens to me all the time, while playing guitar, playing videogames, or anything that ewquires me to concentrate. It is odd how you always seem to do better while you are not concentrating on the task at hand though which I never fully understood…

item.title: Wierd Body/Mind Experience
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Yes actually. This happens to me quite a lot if I’m talking to someone about a completely unrelated topic, while playing MW2. I end up doing pretty good, because I don’t let the situation inside of the game control my mind; whereas I stay calm and end up taking out the 3-4 guys that run around the corner simultaneously, where I normally may not because I’d panic.

Read full topic
